title: Dozens Freed, Hundreds Still Held Hostage As Rebels Hijack Train In Pak
content: Pakistani troops freed dozens of train passengers taken hostage by armed militants in the country's southwest on Tuesday, with hundreds more still being held in the deadly siege.

title: Ukraine Agrees To Ceasefire Proposal, US To Resume Security Assistance
content: Ukraine on Tuesday backed a US proposal for a 30-day general ceasefire with Russia, with the United States in turn agreeing to lift restrictions on military aid and intelligence sharing, a joint statement said.

title: Union Minister Shares Tamil Nadu's Letter On PM SHRI Schools, Row Intensifies
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan shared a letter from the Tamil Nadu school education department that said the southern state was "very keen" to set up PM SHRI Schools, as the Union Minister launched a counter-attack against the DMK.

title: Track Blown Up, Shots Fired: How Rebels Hijacked Train In Pakistan
content: Baloch separatists who hijacked a train with 200-plus people on board Pakistan, had stopped the train inside a tunnel by blowing up the tracks. They had then opened fire at the engine, in which the driver was injured, reported Pakistani news channel

title: "Won't Negotiate, Do Whatever The Hell You Want": Iran President To Trump
content: President Masoud Pezeshkian said Iran would not negotiate with the U.S. while being threatened, telling President Donald Trump to "do whatever the hell you want", Iranian state media reported on Tuesday.

title: Trump Raises Stakes, To Impose 50% Tariff On Steel, Aluminum From Canada
content: President Donald Trump on Tuesday doubled his planned tariffs on all imports of steel and aluminum products from Canada to 50%, in response to the province of Ontario's decision to place a 25% tariff on its electricity exports to the US.

title: Men "Dangerously" Celebrate India Win, Cops Shave Their Heads, Parade Them
content: In an unusual turn of events, police in Madhya Pradesh's Dewas district allegedly punished a group of youngsters for their "exuberant" celebrations following Team India's Champions Trophy victory on Sunday night.

title: Savarkar, 'Chhaava', Abu Azmi: Spotlight On Aurangzeb, 300 Years Later
content: The success of the Bollywood film 'Chhaava' and the recent statements by some leaders, including Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, have thrust the Mughal emperor into the spotlight once again, more than 300 years after his death in 1707.

title: Delhi To Host 20-Nation Security Meet, Ukraine, Gaza Wars To Top Agenda
content: Discussions on the implications of the Russia-Ukraine war and the conflict in the Middle East are the two key agendas of top intelligence officials, who are scheduled to meet for a security conclave in the national capital this weekend.

title: Wasim Akram Loses Cool During Live Show Over Champions Trophy Ceremony Row
content: Wasim Akram admitted being stunned on failing to spot a single PCB official at the ICC Champions Trophy presentation ceremony.

title: Trump tariffs & trade tensions: Why India is best placed in Asia to outperform
content: India’s low volume of goods exports to the US offers a buffer against trade tensions due to Trump's tariff moves, with strong services exports and supportive domestic policies enhancing resilience. Economic recovery strategies include increased government spending, eased monetary policies, moderated food inflation, and robust services exports driving growth, says Morgan Stanley.

title: Ukraine agrees to truce offer by US, America in return to resume aid
content: Ukraine has endorsed a U.S. proposal for a 30-day ceasefire with Russia, with the U.S. agreeing to lift restrictions on military aid and intelligence sharing. Following negotiations in Saudi Arabia, both nations aim to finalize a deal on Ukrainian minerals. President Trump has temporarily halted military aid to Ukraine, emphasizing the pursuit of peace.

title: Opened fire, blew up track: How BLA militants hijacked train in Pakistan
content: A passenger train in Balochistan, Pakistan, was attacked by separatist militants, injuring the driver and resulting in a hostage situation involving over 100 passengers. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility, demanding the withdrawal of security forces to release the hostages. The train was derailed after the militants blew up the railway track.

title: Canada backs down from 25% electricity surcharge after Trump's retaliation
content: Ontario will suspend a 25 percent electricity surcharge on three American states, Premier Doug Ford said Tuesday, after "productive" talks with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. This came after Donald Trump threatened with retaliatory tariffs of 50 per cent on steel and aluminum which was supposed to be effective from tomorrow.

title: Apple loses $174bn in one day as Microsoft, Google lost $750bn on Manic Monday
content: Apple, Microsoft, Tesla, Nvidia, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta suffered significant losses in market value, totaling over $750 billion on Monday, driven by concerns around new tariffs impacting tech companies. Apple alone shed $174 billion, and Tesla saw a 15% drop in stock value, its worst since 2020. The technology sector faces escalating trade tensions and economic uncertainty.

title: Oppn seeks PM’s response on US trade issue in Parl, FM Sitharaman hits back
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi in Lok Sabha demanded a statement from Prime Minister Modi over his discussions with US President Trump on trade and tariffs. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman responded by accusing the opposition of frequently abusing the PM and demanded an apology.

title: Amnesty to Pakistan: Free Ahmadis, protect their shrines
content: Amnesty International has urged Pakistan to release Ahmadis detained in recent weeks and safeguard their worship places. Over 60 Ahmadis, including children, have been jailed and their sites attacked, with police often failing to intervene. Ahmadis face escalating threats from the far-right Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan, prompting calls for justice against perpetrators.

title: Centre bans 2 Kashmir-based groups under UAPA
content: The Indian government has banned two Kashmir-based groups, AAC and JKIM, for five years under UAPA, citing threats to national security. The groups are accused of advocating Kashmir's secession from India. Leaders of both organizations and other political figures in Kashmir have condemned the ban.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO on return-to-office policy: ‘I completely respect people who…’
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon defends the company's strict return-to-office mandate, despite employee concerns and potential talent retention challenges. Employees are required to go back to in-person work five days a week, ending remote work flexibility, with some technology workers contemplating leaving due to the policy.

title: Booze sales in J&K buck ban buzz
content: In J&K, liquor sales are increasing despite political pressure for prohibition due to concerns over alcohol abuse. The government projects a 4% rise in excise revenue, while various political parties, including PDP and BJP, push for a ban. The new excise policy seeks a balanced approach addressing both the harmful effects of alcohol and the development of the liquor industry.

title: Omar forms committee to regularize daily wagers
content: Jammu & Kashmir's chief minister, Omar Abdullah, announced the formation of a committee under chief secretary Atal Dulloo to create a plan for the regularization of daily wagers. Emphasizing the importance of this issue, Abdullah criticized the opposition for their previous lack of action and highlighted the budget’s focus on prioritizing welfare measures within limited resources.

title: Amid protests over Kathua killings, police say 2 boys missing since Feb 27
content: Two cousins, aged 15 and 12, are missing from Kathua after going to graze cattle on February 27. This follows the deaths of three family members allegedly killed by terrorists. Authorities have expanded the search and urged collaboration with other districts. Residents demand better security after several young people in the region have gone missing and been found dead.

title: AIMIM Plans To Expand In Bengal, Contest All Seats In 2026
content: Asadudin Owaisi's AIMIM (All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen) has decided to widen its footprint in West Bengal ahead of next year's assembly election.

title: Gavaskar Ends CT 2025 'Unfair Advantage' Talks, Says "England Didn't Win..."
content: Legendary Indian cricket team batter Sunil Gavaskar ended the debate over India enjoying any kind of 'unfair advantage' during their Champions Trophy 2025 campaign.

title: Chair In Hand, Tongue Sticking Out: Trudeau's Parliament Exit Is Viral
content: After resigning as Prime Minister of Canada, Justin Trudeau was captured exiting Parliament in a playful style -- carrying a chair and with his tongue sticking out.

title: Video: Inside Armoured Vehicle, Jawans Push Through Attacks In Manipur
content: An armoured vehicle of the central security forces came under heavy attacks by protesters from the Kuki tribes in Manipur on the first day of the Centre's order to ensure free movement of people in the crisis-hit state.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: How Elon Musk may have admitted what many Tesla investors ‘fear’
content: Elon Musk acknowledges the challenge of managing his businesses while involved with the Trump administration.

title: Tories table bill amendments to deport foreign criminals
content: The UK's opposition Conservative party proposes a crackdown on illegal migration and foreign criminals, including Indians. They aim to stop visas for countries not reclaiming their citizens, enforce deportation for any crime, and override human rights laws in immigration matters. In 2021, an MoU on migration and mobility was signed with India.

title: Trump takes U-turn on Mars human mission; seen a clipping Musk’s wings
content: US President Donald Trump has downplayed the priority of a human mission to Mars, despite earlier support for Elon Musk's colonization vision. This shift in stance coincides with Trump asserting final authority over staffing and policy decisions, ahead of a Space X Starship explosion.

title: 'I apologize to the American people': Ontario premier says as Donald Trump escalates tariff war
content: Canada supplies half of US aluminium imports and 20 per cent of US steel imports. Trump announced that he would increase tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminium imports by an additional 25 per cent for a total of 50 per cent duties on those commodities for the neighbor after Ontario premier Doug Ford slapped 25 per cent surcharge on electricity and threatened to cut electricity supply to New York, Michigan and Minnesota.

title: 'He took advantage...': White House on Mahmoud Khalil's deportation
content: Asserting the zero-tolerance policy of the administration towards terrorism, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said, "Mahmoud Khalil is an individual who was given the privilege of coming to this country, to study at one of our nation's one of the finest universities. And he took advantage of that opportunity, of that privilege by siding with Hamas terrorists."

title: Trump's USA shows a red flag to green card holders' political activism
content: The Trump administration signals zero tolerance for foreign students and green card holders engaged in political activism deemed supportive of terrorism, emphasizing deportation. Mahmoud Khalil's detention, a Columbia University student linked to Hamas activities, faces legal challenge while officials underscore national security imperatives. Trump's stance ignites debates on free speech and immigration policies.

title: Tinker tailor soldier spy: US intel czar Tulsi Gabbard to visit India
content: US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard is set to visit India, Japan, and Thailand, aiming to bolster Indo-Pacific relations to counter China. Gabbard, known for her close ties with the BJP-RSS establishment, will build significant relationships crucial to President Trump's regional objectives of peace and prosperity.

title: 'Mauritius is like mini India': PM Modi addresses Indian diaspora
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the Indian diaspora in Mauritius, highlighting the deep historical and cultural ties between the two nations. He announced the extension of Overseas Citizen India cards to the seventh generation of the Indian diaspora and expressed gratitude for receiving the highest civilian award from Mauritius.

title: 'Let them abuse me personally': Pradhan attacks DMK over NEP row
content: Union education minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticized DMK leaders for opposing the National Education Policy. He mentioned Tamil language is already in decline in the state and assured no imposition. He emphasized the government's push for promoting Tamil as a medium of instruction till class 5, countering DMK's criticism and urging not to create fear psychosis.

title: $125bn gone in a day: Musk quotes Python to shrug off Tesla rout, X outages
content: Elon Musk faced significant setbacks on March 10, with Tesla's stock plummeting by over 15% and his social media platform X experiencing major outages. The twin crises coincided with market panic and increasing criticism of Musk's political ties to Trump's administration. Additionally, Tesla's declining sales and growing competition, particularly from China's BYD, compound the challenges.

title: Did Serena Williams’ Super Bowl performance reveal Feelings for Drake?
content: Serena Williams' appearance during Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl LIX performance has fueled speculation about her past relationship with Drake. Despite Williams' solid marriage to Alexis Ohanian, fans are questioning the deeper meaning behind her involvement in a performance that seemingly targeted her ex.

title: 'Come to bed': Who is Sarah Wynn Williams making explosive claims about Meta?
content: Sarah Wynn-Williams, a former Facebook director, has made serious allegations against Meta's top executives, including claims of sexual misconduct and unethical practices. Williams accuses Sheryl Sandberg of inappropriate behavior and Mark Zuckerberg of unethical dealings with Beijing. Meta refutes these claims, labeling them as outdated and previously addressed. Meta said since Williams was fired in 2017, she has been paid by anti-Facebook activists.

title: Happy Holi 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Holi, the festival of colors, is a time for spreading love, joy, and togetherness. Share the festive spirit with wishes, messages, and quotes to make the celebration memorable. Embrace the vibrant hues and let them fill your life with happiness and peace.

title: Mauritius announces highest national award for PM Modi
content: Mauritius Prime Minister Navinchandra Ramgoolam announced that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be conferred with the country’s highest civilian award, The Grand Commander of the Order of the Star and Key of the Indian Ocean (GCSK). This visit marks PM Modi as the first Indian to receive this prestigious honor and adds to his growing list of international recognitions.

title: SP MLA Abu Azmi gets anticipatory bail in Aurangzeb remarks case
content: A Mumbai court has granted anticipatory bail to Samajwadi Party MLA Abu Azmi regarding his controversial remarks about Aurangzeb. Azmi has been directed to cooperate with the investigation on specified dates and times. He claims his comments were misrepresented by the media and has requested his suspension be revoked.

title: 'Any resident alien is eligible for deportation': Tom Homan on Mahmoud Khalil
content: Calling it just one out of many as President Donald Trump stated, Tom Homan said. "Did he violate the terms of his visa? Did he violate the terms of his residency here, you know, committing crimes, attacking Israeli students, locking down buildings, destroying property?” "Absolutely," he said adding that "any resident alien" is eligible for deportation if they commit a crime.

title: 'All concerns to be resolved': EC to TMC over EPIC number, other issues
content: The Election Commission of India has assured the Trinamool Congress that concerns about duplicate EPIC numbers, dead voters, and illegal migrants will be resolved. TMC MP Sagarika Ghose highlighted the seriousness of duplicate EPIC cards and the need for transparency. The opposition demanded discussion on voter list irregularities, stressing their importance for democracy and the Constitution.

title: 'Mishra pushed me': BJP, Cong engage in scuffle in Odisha assembly - watch
content: The Odisha assembly descended into chaos as BJP and Congress leaders engaged in a scuffle, with accusations of physical altercation. The unrest began during question hour when senior BJP lawmaker Jaynarayan Mishra allegedly pushed Congress MLA Taraprasad Bahinipati. Speaker Surama Padhy allowed proceedings to continue despite the turmoil.

title: First Sudan, then Gaza, now Ukraine: Meet MBS, the ultimate global power broker
content: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is hosting global leaders to mediate conflicts, including Ukraine's President Zelenskyy discussing Russia's war with him. Riyadh is positioning itself as a neutral mediator, balancing relationships with the US, Russia, and other nations, while aiming to leverage influence in Middle Eastern conflicts and boost foreign investments.

title: Uproar in Rajya Sabha over Kharge's 'thokenge' remark; Congress chief clarifies
content: A ruckus erupted in Rajya Sabha after BJP objected to Mallikarjun Kharge's remarks. Union minister JP Nadda condemned the language used. Kharge apologised and clarified his remarks were against government policy, not the Chair. This followed a heated exchange over remarks made by Union minister Dharmendra Pradhan about the Tamil Nadu government and DMK.

title: Tiger has surgery for ruptured Achilles tendon
content: Tiger Woods, who hasn't competed in a PGA Tour event this season, said he had surgery to repair a ruptured left Achilles tendon and expects to make a full recovery.

title: Jones joins Colts, to battle Richardson for QB job
content: Free agent quarterback Daniel Jones is finalizing a one-year, $14 million contract with the Colts, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Texans acquire Eagles' Gardner-Johnson
content: The Texans are acquiring safety C.J. Gardner-Johnson from the Eagles in exchange for 2022 first-round pick Kenyon Green, sources told ESPN. The two teams will also swap a pair of draft picks in the deal.

title: Vikings add Allen, Fries to strengthen both lines
content: The Vikings strengthened their defensive and offensive lines Tuesday, agreeing to deals with free agent defensive tackle Jonathan Allen and guard Will Fries.

title: Sources: Cowboys, Turpin agree to 3-year deal
content: The Dallas Cowboys have agreed to a three-year, $18 million deal with All-Pro returner KaVontae Turpin, sources tell ESPN.

title: Thomas: Past 'level of exhaustion' over LIV, PGA
content: Justin Thomas said Tuesday that both PGA Tour and LIV players are "past the level of exhaustion" when it comes to the ongoing reunification talks.

title: Eye test: Hundreds of logos dotting Big 12 court
content: Having hundreds of XII logos emblazoned sideline to sideline on the basketball court being used for the Big 12 tournament has become a polarizing topic.

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: Free agency has kicked off with the legal negotiation window and there has already been plenty of action.

title: Men's Bracketology: Auburn stays No. 1; Gonzaga's WCC semifinal win keeps it in the hunt
content: Auburn has lost back-to-back games but is still positioned for the top overall seed as automatic bids begin coming off the table.

title: 'He's got it': An oral history of the NBA's COVID-19 shutdown -- and how it changed sports forever
content: On the fifth anniversary of the night the NBA shut down, ESPN reveals how it happened, down to the minute -- told by the players, executives, politicians, doctors and journalists who were there.

title: Women's Bracketology: Gonzaga upset, likely to miss NCAA tournament for first time since 2016
content: The 1-seeds and top 16 are set. But a trio of upsets to No. 1 conference seeds sent shock waves throughout the rest of the bracket.

title: Olney: Yankees must replace Gerrit Cole -- but they'll probably have to wait
content: Fans might want a big splash after New York lost its ace, but the right fit emerging could be months away.

title: A 40-year-old throwing 94.5 mph? A .696 batting average!? Spring training numbers we do (and don't) believe in
content: It's hard to know which stats to trust this time of year. So we dig in to separate what's real from the March mirages.

title: The ACC is on track for its fewest men's NCAA tournament bids in 25 years -- what's next?
content: The storied college basketball conference is in flux, but it's banking on an injection of money and young wave of coaches to carry it into this new era.

title: NHL playoff watch: Who will make the Eastern Conference finals?
content: The Hurricanes and Lightning both have good shots, and they face off Tuesday on ESPN+. Plus, updated playoff projections, draft lottery outlook, more.

title: Man United's new stadium will be big, but it won't be world's biggest football ground
content: Manchester United's proposed new 100,000-seat home will be one of the world's largest soccer stadiums, but it won't be the biggest.

title: Juan Soto first OF pick in last mock before Opening Day
content: Check out the results of our first fantasy baseball head-to-head points mock draft of 2025, featuring round-by-round picks and a snapshot of the rosters of all 10 teams.

title: Man Utd CEO: New stadium poses 'risk' to team
content: Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada has admitted the club "risk" falling further behind their rivals while they invest in their new stadium.

title: Yamal, Raphinha dazzle as Barca reach UCL last-8
content: Raphinha scored twice and Lamine Yamal netted with a stunning strike as a superb Barcelona dismantled Benfica 3-1 in the second leg of their Champions League last-16 tie on Tuesday, advancing to the quarter-finals with a 4-1 aggregate victory.

title: Adams, Reyna top USMNT Concacaf NL roster
content: The returns of Bournemouth midfielder Tyler Adams and Borussia Dortmund attacker Gio Reyna highlight Mauricio Pochettino's 23-player roster for the final stage of the Concacaf Nations League.

title: Tchouaméni: Criticism of Mbappé is 'incredible'
content: Aurélien Tchouaméni has called criticism of Kylian Mbappé "incredible" ahead of Real Madrid's Champions League round of 16 second leg away at rivals Atlético Madrid on Wednesday.

title: PSV to compensate fans at Arsenal tie after 7-1
content: PSV have announced that they will compensate their fans attending the second leg of their round of 16 Champions League tie at Arsenal on Wednesday.

title: Sources: Pogba to wait for new club as ban ends
content: Paul Pogba's 18-month ban from football officially ended on Tuesday, but he has decided to delay joining a new club, sources have told ESPN.

title: Palmeiras slam 'absurd' punishment for racism
content: Palmeiras president Leila Mejdalani Pereira said CONMEBOL's punishment of Cerro Porteno for racial abuse against Palmeiras Under-20 player Luighi was too lenient, criticizing the South American governing body's treatment of Brazilian clubs.

title: Arsenal's Saliba: I've not been so good this season
content: Arsenal defender William Saliba has admitted he has "not been so good" this season and said he needs to demand more of himself to help the club win silverware this season.

title: NWSL ambition rankings: Who is No. 1 in 2025 when it comes to raising the game?
content: With the 2025 NWSL season kicking off this weekend, it's time to unveil our second annual ambition rankings. Which teams are leading the way and who is just trying to keep up?

title: College softball rankings: The Top 25 teams after Week 5
content: Here's the updated college softball Top 25 poll for Week 5. Where does South Carolina rank after being swept by Oklahoma?

title: Waiver wire pickups: Look to Naji Marshall, Stephon Castle
content: The waiver wire always has players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add this week.

title: Ferrari's debut winners: Can Lewis Hamilton join list of legends?
content: Some of the biggest names in F1 history have won in their debuts with Ferrari, a feat Lewis Hamilton will look to replicate on Sunday in Australia.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah open to Barcelona move
content: manchester city have placed Eduardo Camavinga on their list of options for the summer transfer window . the 22-year-old hasn't decided whether he wants to leave Los Blancos and has a contract that runs until 2029 . rumours have sounded out Barcelona over a potential move .

title: Why the Seahawks are taking a risk choosing Sam Darnold as their next QB
content: the seahawks are giving free agent Sam Darnold $55 million in guarantees, according to ESPN's Adam Schefter . the team's top decision-maker was leaving the door cracked for what would be a blockbuster quarterback swap . "we expect him to be our guy," Schneider said .

title: Why newly acquired QB Justin Fields will play position like no other in Jets history
content: the pendulum often swings in the opposite direction because it overcompensates for its perceived shortcomings . the theory applies to the Jets and their quarterback situation . fields has averaged 50.2 rushing yards per game in four seasons .

title: UCL live blog: Liverpool host PSG; Leverkusen, Bayern renew rivalry
content: Tuesday marks the first day of the round of 16 second legs for the 2024-25  UEFA Champions League  season. Europe's premier club competition is now whittling down teams as the quarterfinals awaits the winners. Enjoy the play-by-play from all of Tuesday's games:  Liverpool  against  Paris Saint-Germain ,  Bayer Leverkusen  against  Bayern Munich  and  Internazionale  against  Feyenoord .

title: 49ers' purge continues with release of DE Floyd
content: the 49ers released defensive end Leonard Floyd on Tuesday . he is the latest 49ers veteran who has been or will be jettisoned by the team this offseason . they also plan to release defensive tackle Javon Hargrave, fullback Kyle Juszczyk and defensive tackle Maliek Collins .

title: MLS Power Rankings: Miami stays top, Galaxy in free fall
content: the 2025 MLS season is now firmly underway, which means it's time for ESPN's Power Rankings . our writers studied the action from across Matchday 3 to come up with this week's order of all 30 teams in the league .

title: Ravens bringing back Pro Bowl fullback Ricard
content: the Baltimore Ravens kept a major part of their dominant rushing attack . the one-year deal is fully guaranteed for around $3 million, a source says . Ricard was named first-team All-Pro for the first time last season . last season, Ricard cleared the way for derrick Henry to gain 1,921 yards .

title: What's next for Justin Gaethje and other stars from UFC 313?
content: Justin Gaethje beats Rafael Fiziev by unanimous decision in the co-main event . the light heavyweight champion could challenge for the lightweight title next . he could be on the shortlist of fighters who could challenge Islam Makhachev . click here for all the latest boxing news .

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Ankalaev is in, but what about Pereira?
content: ankalaev enters the top 10 for the first time on a pair of ballots . one voter has him in the top four, while another puts him near the bottom of the rankings . both light heavyweights -- former champ and current one -- are in the ESPN men's pound-for-pound top 10 .

title: 'Volunteer for Life': Inside Tennessee legend Chris Lofton's incredible story
content: it's been 17 years since Chris Lofton played for the university of Tennessee . he was one of the most beloved athletes in the history of the university . the former volunteer was a legend for volunteers fans and beyond . but he never felt sorry for himself .

title: 283 Indians trapped in illegal jobs in Myanmar rescued, brought back
content: They were forced to work in fraudulent call centres operating in regions along Myanmar-Thailand border and were subsequently made to indulge in cybercrime and other fraudulent activities

title: RSS leader wants India to be called only as ‘Bharat’
content: Dattatreya Hosabale questions if anywhere in the world a country has two names, one in Hindi and the other in English

title: TMC, BJP delegations rally before ECI over discrepancies in WB voter list
content: The TMC delegation said that EPIC numbers are unique and it remains unclear as to “how many duplicate votes have been cast across various elections due to this EPIC number issue”; The BJP leaders called for an extensive review of W.B. voter list

title: God will protect the author of this judgment, says judge after ruling that temple property can be acquired for public purpose
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh holds against CMRL’s attempt to acquire an insurance company’s property in order to spare a temple land

title: Tejashwi, sister Rohini slam Bihar CM over ₹25 crore robbery in Ara
content: On March 10, six armed men pretending to be customers carried out a heist by robbing the jewellery at gunpoint. Police have recovered two out of three bags looted from the showroom apart from arresting two robbers.

title: A comedian and a musician set sparks flying at The Hindu office
content: Their conversation ranged from how to deal with criticism, separating art from artists, questioning hegemonic spaces, to sartorial choices

title: RJD MP submits ‘evidence’ against Bihar’s Finance Department officials to PMO, CAG
content: He alleged abuse of power by Bihar Chief Minister’s Principal Secretary and Finance Department’s Principal Secretary

title: Kochi metro phase-III could extend up to Ayyampuzha, say officials
content: This would help usher in Transit Oriented Development on the stretch, helping decongest the city, they say

title: Even before Katchatheevu was ceded, Sri Lanka had periodically arrested Tamil Nadu fishers
content: While visiting Rameswaram recently, Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi blamed the 1974 cession of Katchatheevu to Sri Lanka for the continuing arrest of fishermen. However, according to reports from The Hindu Archives, even before the islet was ceded, fishermen were arrested periodically by the Sri Lankan Navy on the charge of poaching

title: Don’t stand in the way of aspirations of students, Dharmendra Pradhan tells Tamil Nadu government
content: Decline in enrolment in Tamil-medium schools shows a clear shift in preference, the Union Education Minister says

title: The first judge of the Supreme Court to face impeachment proceedings
content: An impeachment motion was moved against him in the Lok Sabha for extravagant spending when he was the Chief Justice of the Punjab and Haryana High Court. When it was put to vote on May 11, 1993, of the 401 members present, 196 backed the motion and 205 abstained. Calls for his resignation continued, but he retired in February 1994

title: Desilting work begins in Mordhana dam canal near Gudiyatham
content: Thick vegetation on the canal bed has prevented steady flow of water. It resulted in breach of the bund, resulting in inundation. The entire desilt and other works will be completed before northeast monsoon, says an official

title: ASHA workers will get enhanced remuneration, says Health Minister Nadda
content: The announcement comes at a time when there has been demand from across the country that ASHA workers, who form the backbone of the government’s outreach programme to reduce infant and maternal mortality, should get better pay

title: How Mysuru zoo is keeping its animals cool in the searing heat
content: A number of initiatives have been introduced to reduce heat stress among the animals and ensure their well-being

title: T.N. Education Minister and Centre spar over State’s stance on NEP
content: Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi and Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan clash over National Education Policy on social media.

title: Proposed immigration law seeks to add more teeth to existing rules
content: Stricter penalties for violations such as use of forged travel documents, non-adherence to visa conditions, overstay, and deliberately avoiding registration with the Foreigners Regional Registration Office

title: Highways still blocked in Churachandpur, Kangpokpi as Union Home Ministry team begins talks with Kuki Zo groups
content: Security convoys stopped in Kangpokpi, which remains shut; Churachandpur opens for economic activity, but women protestors only allow entry of vehicles carrying essential commodities

title: Don’t arrest Ranya’s husband without due process of law: Karnataka High Court
content: Jatin Hukkeri states he married Ranya in November last year, and their relationship began to sour within months

title: Kharge questions Nadda over Minister’s absence from RS
content: Why doesn’t he train his Ministers who don’t turn up on time, asks Kharge, a day after Nadda suggested that the Opposition take a refresher course in parliamentary rules

title: ‘Habitual offender’ laws in effect in 14 States and UTs, government tells Lok Sabha
content: Gujarat explicitly opines against repealing it, many others say the law is practically redundant; Supreme Court had urged States to reconsider the need for it altogether

title: Finance Minister announces ₹500-crore corpus for strife-torn Manipur
content: Asserting that overall law and order situation has improved in the State, except for some sporadic incidents, Nirmala Sitharaman says all financial support will be provided to Manipur

title: States with successful family planning record will be ‘penalised’ in delimitation exercise: Congress
content: Citing an analysis of 2001, 2011 Census data, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh says T.N., Kerala, undivided Andhra Pradesh set to lose 8 LS seats each due to delimitation, while U.P. to gain 11 seats, and Bihar 10

title: Kerala continues to grapple with flip side of migration
content: In just one year, three Keralites were killed in foreign territory by armies while undertaking a risky migration.  Kerala, which has a long history of organised migration, is now grappling with the challenges of irregular migration

title: PVR INOX case: HC stays Bengaluru consumer commission’s order
content: The commission had imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on PVR INOX multiplex for playing commercial advertisements for about 25 minutes and delaying the screening of a movie last year.

title: Tamil Nadu School Education Department dismisses 23 teachers, staff facing charges under POCSO Act
content: According to sources in the department, the move was taken after a final investigation was conducted by the department regarding 46 cases against teachers.

title: Former CJI Ranjan Gogoi criticises Bill on simultaneous elections
content: At a meeting of Parliament’s Joint Committee reviewing the Bill, Justice Gogoi said Election Commission cannot be given unregulated powers to decide the tenure of a State Assembly

title: Top global intelligence czars to converge in India this weekend to hold crucial deliberations
content: India’s National Security Advisor Ajit Doval will chair the India-hosted conclave on March 16, which is expected to deliberate on ways to enhance intelligence sharing to combat terrorism and various transnational crimes

title: Farmers demand release of water from KRS, Kabini reservoirs to fill up waterbodies
content: They said that several standing crops, fruits and vegetables were drying up under the scorching summer sun

title: Land ownership granted to families relocated due to landslide threat in Thrissur’s Akamala
content: Land documents and tax payment receipts handed over to beneficiaries by District Collector Arjun Pandian

title: Mauritius is family, it’s bridge between India and Global South: PM Modi tells diaspora
content: On March 12, 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the island nation's national day celebrations as the chief guest.

title: Koodalmanikyam temple row: staffer says he is not interested in ‘Kazhakam’ duties any more
content: Balu says he will send a letter to the Devaswom authorities. Representatives of priests say appointment violated devaswom rules

title: Enhanced security and fire safety measures in place for Attukal Pongala
content: City police implements comprehensive security plan to ensure public safety during the spiritual event which attracts thousands of devotees from across the State and beyond

title: Jadavpur University deadlock might end soon as authorities likely to hold talks with police
content: Classes and exams have been restored but police presence on campus has raised questions of safety and democratic environment in the academic space.

title: Western mercenaries who fought in Ukraine war are entering Myanmar via Mizoram to train rebels, claims CM Lalduhoma
content: “We have specific intelligence that the Ukraine war veterans travelled to Myanmar’s Chin State via Mizoram to train rebel outfits fighting the military junta,” Mr. Lalduhoma told the State Assembly

title: BJP Councillor Arrested For Allegedly Shooting At Ex Soldier's Son In UP
content: A BJP councillor has been arrested for allegedly shooting a man in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, the police said. The police said a handgun has been recovered from the accused, Ajay Tomar. The injured man, Mayank Gurjar, is being treated at a local hospital, the police said. The councillor and the man had some old enmity over which they frequently quarrelled, the police said. Before the shooting incident, an argument broke out between Mr Tomar and the man near a private school, after which the councillor shot the man in his thigh. Reports said Mr Gurjar's father was a soldier, and he was also preparing to join the Army. The family told the police said Mr Gurjar and the BJP leader had an altercation 15 days ago over a petty matter. Mr Gurjar alleged the councillor abused him over the phone. Track  Latest News  Live on NDTV.com and get  news  updates from  India   and around the  world

title: Three textile parks under way in A.P. with over ₹310 crore
content: In reply to a question by Nellore MP Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy, MoS for Commerce and Industry Jitin Prasada said that ₹49.66 crore was released for infra projects in A.P. under MSME-CDP during 2024-25

title: Railways make elaborate arrangements for Attukal Pongala
content: Special train services, additional stoppages, enhanced ticketing facilities, and increased security arrangements in place

title: Siddhartha Academy of Higher Education receives a donation of  ₹20 lakh from alumnus
content: The amount would be utilised to enhance the research infrastructure in the Antenna and RF Engineering Laboratory and it would be named P. J. Moorthy Antenna and RF Engineering Laboratory

title: Jagan exploited volunteers for political mileage before betraying them without any livelihood guarantee, laments Nadendla Manohar
content: A majority of the youths employed by Mr. Jagan was Ward & Village volunteers; Mr. Jagan went to the general elections without renewing their term, says Mr. Manohar
